subject: Re: [junit] How to test a method without the return value by  junit?
msgSnippet: ... Quoting the original poster: I can not change the source programme . The only other way that I can think of is using JunitX (search the archives for
messageBody:
At 01:32 PM 09/10/01, you wrote:
>Quoting chenhuitao@...:
>STORE THE VALUE IN SOME VARIABLE ....ACCESS THAT VARIABLE THRU A OBJECT OF
>THE CLASS TO WHICH IT BELONGS


Quoting the original poster: "I can not change the source programme".


The only other way that I can think of is using JunitX (search the archives
for details) to access the private members if you have no way of accessing
them directly. Of course, this is not exactly testing the method, but
rather the effect of the method on the variables.



Jim



> > I am a newbie to junit.But now i have a job in my hand.I need to use
> > JUnit to test some existed java programme.Some methods of classes
> > have no return value.I can not change the source programme.How can I
> > test these programme by JUnit?
> > Thank you for your any help!
> > //BR ChenHuitao
